column4: i want to creat a usb startup disk in ubuntu , for windows , how
ive heard you can 'dd' the win7 iso to a pendrive.. but never tried it.
what ?
Huh?
i just want to install windows along with ubuntu for the other computer
and windows will overwrite the grub bootloader. and you will have to some how reparir the grub boot loader.
if you have a spare flash drive. you can set up grub on it in addation to on the hard drive. and use the pendrive to boot the linux os. after windows  overwrites grub..
you an put the iso on a usb in many differnt ways... if thats what you want.
i just use  the tools, or do an image to my pendrive.
how , you must use a software , not just copy the iso file to your pendrive
you can use 'dd' to IMAGE the iso to a pendrive - starting with 11.10 - but that wont make a persistant save file.
i only use a persistant setup for a few special cases. I found them to be to fragile.
vlc foo.iso   may work
vlc foo.iso isn't work, but Gskellig's working.
ethtool. ifconfig

you can change the mac yes
